content.question: In which of the following free-body diagrams is the magnitude of the vector sum of the forces the greatest?

choices.label: The figure shows a free body diagram with four arrows extending from a dot. The first arrow extends vertically upward. The second arrow extends upward and to the right. The third arrow extends downward and to the right. The fourth arrow extends vertically downward.

The figure shows a free body diagram with four arrows of equal lengths extending from a dot. The first arrow extends upward and to the right. The second arrow extends slightly upward and to the right. The third arrow extends slightly downward and to the right. The fourth arrow extends downward and to the right.

The figure shows a free body diagram with four arrows of equal lengths extending from a dot. The first arrow extends vertically upward. The second arrow extends horizontally to the right. The third arrow extends vertically downward. The fourth arrow extends horizontally to the left.

The figure shows a free body diagram with four arrows of equal lengths extending from a dot. The first arrow extends slightly upward and to the left. The second arrow extends slightly upward and to the right. The third arrow extends horizontally to the right. The fourth arrow extends horizontally to the left.

content.answer: The figure shows a free body diagram with four arrows of equal lengths extending from a dot. The first arrow extends upward and to the right. The second arrow extends slightly upward and to the right. The third arrow extends slightly downward and to the right. The fourth arrow extends downward and to the right.
